required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reactogenicity and Immunogenicity of Third Dose Vaccine Booster Following Two Doses of Inactivated Vaccines
clinical_study.official_title: Reactogenicity and Immunogenicity of Third Dose Vaccine Booster Following Two Doses of Inactivated Vaccines

brief_summary.textblock:
Multi-center randomized controlled clinical trial, We intended to recruit the participants who completed 2 doses of inactivated COVID-19 vaccine 4-8 months before, and volunteered to receive the third dose of vaccine (inactivated vaccine, or recombinant subunit protein vaccine and mRNA vaccine) into the experimental group, and the participants who completed 2 doses of inactivated COVID-19 vaccine 4-8 months before without a third dose of vaccination plan into the control group. Participants in the experimental group received the third dose of SARS-CoV-2 vaccination at baseline, and participants in the control group received no intervention. Each subject will be followed up for one year after enrollment, and neutralizing antibodies and total antibodies will be tested at the specified time points, as well as the records of adverse events and adverse reactions.
The study set up 4 groups, 100 people each for inactivated vaccine, recombinant subunit protein vaccine, mRNA vaccine and the control group, totaling 400 people.

primary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity of Third Dose Vaccine Booster Following Two Doses of Inactivated Vaccines
primary_outcome.description: Observe the 28th day of the subjects' live virus neutralizing antibody geometric mean titers (GMTs) and mean geometric titers fold growth (GMFR) changes

primary_outcome.measure: Reactogenicity of Third Dose Vaccine Booster Following Two Doses of Inactivated Vaccines
primary_outcome.description: All solicited and non-solicited adverse events within 28 days.

secondary_outcome.measure: The seropositive rate of neutralizing antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 days/14 days/28days/45days/60 days/90 days/180 days/365 days
secondary_outcome.description: The seropositive rate of neutralizing antibodies after third vaccination shots

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 days/14 days/28days/45days/60 days/90 days/180 days/365 days
secondary_outcome.description: GMT of neutralizing antibodies after third vaccination shots

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 days/14 days/28days/45days/60 days/90 days/180 days/365 days
secondary_outcome.description: GMFR of neutralizing antibodies after third vaccination shots

secondary_outcome.measure: severe adverse events and adverse events of special interest
secondary_outcome.description: severe adverse events and adverse events of special interest

arm_group.description: Participants volunteered not to receive the third dose of vaccine
Participants volunteered to receive the third dose of inactivated vaccine
Participants volunteered to receive the third dose of subunit protein vaccine
Participants volunteered to receive the third dose of mRNA vaccine

intervention.description: Multi-center randomized controlled clinical trial, We intended to recruit the participants who completed 2 doses of inactivated COVID-19 vaccine 4-8 months before, and volunteered to receive the third dose of vaccine (inactivated vaccine, or recombinant subunit protein vaccine and mRNA vaccine) into the experimental group, and the participants who completed 2 doses of inactivated COVID-19 vaccine 4-8 months before without a third dose of vaccination plan into the control group. Participants in the experimental group received the third dose of SARS-CoV-2 vaccination at baseline, and participants in the control group received no intervention. Each subject will be followed up for one year after enrollment, and neutralizing antibodies and total antibodies will be tested at the specified time points, as well as the records of adverse events and adverse reactions.
